title: Biden Picks Fed’s Jefferson for Vice Chair, Kugler for Governor
description: President Joe Biden has picked Federal Reserve Governor Philip Jefferson for a promotion to vice chair and will nominate economist Adriana Kugler to an open board slot, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: US Senate Votes to Restore Solar Tariffs Up to 254% in Biden Rebuke
description: The Senate voted Wednesday to reinstate tariffs as high as 254% on solar panels from Southeast Asia, underscoring a deep clash over continued US reliance on foreign imports to drive the nation’s renewable-energy development.

title: NY Times Beats Trump Suit Over Pulitzer Report on His Taxes
description: A judge dismissed Donald Trump’s $100 million lawsuit against the New York Times and its reporters over an award-winning 2018 expose on his taxes.

title: Brazil Central Bank Keeps Interest Rate at 13.75%, Resisting Lula’s Pressure
description: Policymakers held the benchmark Selic steady again despite Lula pushing for looser monetary policy to boost growth

title: Debt-Limit Breach Could Kill Millions of Jobs, White House Economists Warn
description: The White House warned ahead of President Joe Biden’s meeting Tuesday with congressional leaders that a breach of the debt ceiling would “likely cause severe damage to the US economy” and that a protracted default could result in millions of jobs lost.

title: Biden and McCarthy Vie for Leverage as Debt-Ceiling Clock Ticks Down
description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, White House reporter Josh Wingrove looks at the standoff over the debt ceiling. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics.

title: US Regional Banks ‘Need Consolidation,’ Canyon’s Lemkin Says
description: Recent banking failures shows how regulators are overwhelmed by too many institutions, causing them to overlook regional banks, Todd Lemkin, Canyon Partners’ chief investment officer said.

title: US Is Vulnerable to China’s Lock on Key Minerals, Biden Aide Says
description: The US economy is vulnerable to China’s “lock” on critical mineral processing, a senior adviser to President Joe Biden said, likening the situation to the risk Europe faced from its reliance on Russia’s oil and gas amid its invasion of Ukraine.

title: CFTC Inspector General Identified Whistleblowers and Wasted Funds, Probe Finds
description: A top Wall Street regulator is making moves that could lead to the ouster of its inspector general after an independent probe found he had disclosed the identities of whistleblowers, wasted money and disparaged agency employees.

title: US Would Support IMF Speeding Up Loan Funds to Argentina
description: The Biden administration would support speeding up disbursements from Argentina’s $44 billion program with the International Monetary Fund, if the nation’s authorities can successfully negotiate a new schedule with the lender, according to US officials familiar with the matter.

title: Russian Billionaire Timchenko Says Knowing Putin Doesn’t Make Him Ally
description: Russian billionaire Gennady Timchenko attacked the European Union’s decision to sanction him, saying his close ties to President Vladimir Putin don’t mean he’s an ally in the war in Ukraine.

title: NATO Warns That Russia Is Mapping EU, US Critical Assets
description: NATO’s intelligence chief said that Russia is mapping critical undersea systems and warned of a significant risk that Moscow could target infrastructure in Europe and North America.

title: Senate Democrats Planning Bill to Counter Rise in China Clout
description: Senate Democrats plan to announce Wednesday that they’ll begin drafting a new comprehensive bill to enhance US economic competition with China and prepare a response in case of Chinese aggression against Taiwan.

title: Finland Election Winner Signals Progress in Coalition Talks
description: Finland’s election winner signaled progress in talks to form a pro-business ruling coalition in the Nordic nation, reiterating the aim of reaching a government deal by next month.

title: US Turns to Familiar Name to Clean Up $114 Billion Banking Mess: BlackRock
description: Once again, Washington is turning to its favorite Wall Street cleaning crew to pick up after the US banking industry.

title: Australia Budget Gap to Narrow Sharply Then Swell, Deloitte Says
description: Australia’s fiscal coffers will see a windfall gain from tax revenue due to high commodity prices and low unemployment, Deloitte Access Economics said, even as the nation’s long-term structural deficit worsens.

title: Starmer Criticises Tory Record on Mortgages and Housing Ahead of Local Elections
description: Sir Keir Starmer said millions will pay the price of Tory "recklessness" in higher mortgages and a shortage of homes as the party leaders clashed in their final exchanges before local elections in England on Thursday.

title: Russia Says It Downed Drone Attack on Putin’s Kremlin Residence
description: Russia said it defeated an attack by a pair of drones on President Vladimir Putin’s residence in the Kremlin in Moscow Tuesday night, blaming the attempt on Ukraine.

title: South Africa Upgrades Banknotes to Thwart Counterfeiting
description: South African Reserve Bank Governor Lesetja Kganyago unveiled upgraded banknotes on Wednesday that will incorporate enhanced security features, including color-changing ink, to prevent counterfeiting.

title: F1 Driver Mazepin Dumped After Ukraine Invasion Fights Sanctions
description: Nikita Mazepin, the Formula One racing driver dropped from his team following Russia’s invasion of Ukraine, has turned to court to lift British sanctions calling them “unlawful.”

title: Brazil Police Search Bolsonaro’s Home On False Covid Data
description: Brazil’s Federal Police carried out searches in the home of the former president Jair Bolsonaro on Wednesday, according to a source involved in the investigations.

title: EU to Speed Up Lifting of Immunity in Crackdown on Corruption
description: The European Union’s executive proposed stricter rules aimed at lifting immunity in criminal investigations faster as part of an overhaul of anti-corruption laws amid scandals such as the Qatar bribery affair that’s roiled the bloc’s own parliament.

title: EU Pledges €500 Million to Boost Ammunition Output in Europe
description: The European Union is setting aside €500 million ($551 million) to boost manufacturing of artillery shells, missiles and gunpowder in an effort to speed up production of ammunition for Ukraine and galvanize the bloc’s defense industry.

title: The Politics of Migration Are Proving Intractable
description: Immigration has become an intractable political issue in the rich world.

title: The Company Behind Ben Shapiro Is Trying to Build a Right-Wing Magic Kingdom
description: The Daily Wire has ridden culture war outrage and transphobia into a breakout media business. Now it has its sights set on entertainment—and an entire alternative economy.

title: Teenager Kills Nine in Serbian School Shooting Massacre
description: A teenager opened fire on his classmates in central Belgrade, killing eight and a security guard, while injuring another six schoolchildren and a teacher, Serbian police said Wednesday.

title: Billionaire UK Tory Party Treasurer to Suspend Russian Business
description: A company co-owned by UK Conservative Party Senior Treasurer Mohamed Mansour is suspending its business activities in Russia after British media reported that the firm was supplying machinery to the Russian oil and gas industry.

title: Yacht of Sanctioned Russian Citizen Raided in German Port
description: A yacht belonging to a sanctioned 67-old Russian entrepreneur was raided by Frankfurt prosecutors at a port in northern Germany.

title: Dissident Journalist Taken From Plane Forced to Land In Belarus Sentenced to 8 Years
description: TALLINN, Estonia (AP) — A Belarusian court convicted a dissident journalist who was arrested after being pulled off a commercial flight that was diverted to the country and sentenced him Wednesday to eight years in prison.

title: IMF Says Egypt Is Serious About Applying Flexible Exchange Rate
description: Egypt is “serious” about applying a flexible foreign exchange rate regime, a senior International Monetary Fund official told Arabic TV channel Asharq, as the Mideast’s most populous nation works to restore investor confidence in an economy battered by the fallout from Russia’s invasion of Ukraine.

title: Ukraine’s Zelenskiy Makes Surprise Visit to Finland Wednesday
description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy is making a surprise visit to Finland on Wednesday to join the prime ministers of the Nordic nations to discuss their plans to back the country against Russian aggression.

title: Supreme Court Takes on Federal Agency Power With Chevron Case
description: Conservatives who for years have pushed judges to rein in federal bureaucrats have a chance to claim their biggest prize yet as the Supreme Court considers toppling a 39-year-old precedent that critics say has fueled an explosion of government overreach.

title: Le Maire Says French Retailers Agree to Extend Price Cuts
description: French retailers have agreed to prolong efforts to charge the lowest possible amount for some essential food items as high consumer-price increases continue to hurt households, Finance Minister Bruno Le Maire said.

title: Taliban, China Envoys to Meet in Pakistan in Belt and Road Push
description: Taliban’s top diplomat will travel to Pakistan later this week to hold talks with his Chinese counterpart Qin Gang that could include extending a Belt and Road Initiative to Afghanistan.

title: Teenage Boy Opens Fire in School in Serbia Capital, Causing Injuries
description: BELGRADE, Serbia (AP) — A teenage boy opened fire early Wednesday in a school in central Belgrade, causing injuries, Serbian police said.

title: Ukraine Latest: Russian Drones Target Cities Including Kyiv
description: Russia launched attacks on several cities overnight using Iranian Shahed drones, most of which were shot down by air-defense systems, local officials said.

title: Swiss Lower House Passes Bill to Ban Some Bonuses at Big Banks
description: Switzerland’s lower house passed a bill to ban systemically relevant banks from paying some bonuses, limiting payouts for top executives and risk managers.

title: Ex-Zambian Leader Lungu’s House Surrounded by Police, Party Says
description: Zambian police surrounded the house of ex-President Edgar Lungu and demanded access to search it, a spokesman for the former ruling Patriotic Front party said.

title: Hungary Approves Judicial Changes to Tap €13 Billion in EU Funds
description: Hungary’s parliament passed legislation aimed at de-politicizing the courts in an effort to unlock almost half of the funds the European Union has blocked over rule of law and corruption concerns.

title: Thaksin’s Daughter to Return to Campaign Trail After Child Birth
description: Paetongtarn Shinawatra, a frontrunner for the prime minister’s job in Thailand’s general election this month, will rejoin the campaign trail just days after giving birth to her second child to help her Pheu Thai Party’s bid to end a near-decade military-backed rule.

title: China Sends Drones Circling Taiwan in New Surveillance Tactic
description: China’s military sent a drone circling around Taiwan for the second time in a week, the island’s defense ministry said Wednesday, signaling a new surveillance tactic as cross-strait tensions remain high.

title: Myanmar Pardons 2,153 Jailed for Dissent Against Military Regime
description: Myanmar’s military regime on Wednesday pardoned 2,153 prisoners jailed for criticizing the junta after it seized control of the government in a coup more than two years ago.

title: What UK Local Elections Will Say About Labour’s Bid for Power
description: PM Rishi Sunak’s party is facing big losses at the polls. Will Keir Starmer do enough to set him on course for Downing Street?

title: Ukraine’s Allies Seek to Close More Russia Sanctions Loopholes
description: The US, Europe and other key allies of Ukraine are preparing fresh penalties against Russia to try and tighten the net on President Vladimir Putin’s economy more than 14 months into his war, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: Erdogan Faces Turkish Voters Angered by Years of Economic Chaos
description: From markets in Bursa to universities near Ankara and the streets of Berlin, the mood among many Turkish voters is tilting against Recep Tayyip Erdogan and could thwart the powerful president’s reelection bid.

title: US Lawmakers Query Nike, Adidas Over Forced Labor in China
description: U.S. House lawmakers are requesting information from Nike Inc., Adidas AG and at least two other companies on whether they are importing products derived from forced labor in China.

title: Lula Says He’s Started Talks With BRICS Bank to Help Argentina
description: Brazil President Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva on Tuesday said he’s actively working to help Argentina overcome its financial crisis after meetings with its president, Alberto Fernandez, in Brasilia.

title: Texas Suspect Caught After 5 Neighbors Killed With AR-Style Rifle
description: CLEVELAND, Texas (AP) — Authorities near Houston say they have caught a man suspected of killing five of his neighbors, including a 9-year-old boy, with an AR-style rifle after the family confronted him late at night about firing rounds in his yard.

title: South Korea Presses China to Address Pyongyang Nuclear Threat
description: South Korea President Yoon Suk Yeol urged China to reduce the nuclear threat posed by North Korea, responding directly to Beijing’s displeasure over the US ally’s new security agreement with Washington.

title: Former SVB Chief Greg Becker Is Set to Testify to Senate on Bank Collapses
description: The former chief executive officer of Silicon Valley Bank and the former leaders of Signature Bank are to be among the witnesses at Senate Banking Committee hearings on US bank failures.

title: New Zealand Government Hit by Defection As Election Looms
description: New Zealand’s governing Labour Party has been hit by the defection of a minister just five months before the nation holds a general election.
